intro: Luma hoehnei, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has simple, ovate leaves and produces woody pods containing seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Luma hoehnei is also valued for its ability to provide shade and its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
